title: This guy ruining so many games proves your system is broken!
body:
Playing ranked as jungler with one win left in promos and got just got matched a guy who queued up as support.  He picks Nunu, and I think nothing of it as his snowball spam is indeed annoyingly strong.  He doesn't take Exhaust, or Ignite, but Smite, should've been a clue I guess.

In game he doesn't go botlane, but straight to my buff, and consumes it from me because he's Nunu and I'm Zac and can't do anything about it.  He then does this to EVERY, SINGLE, CAMP for the rest of the game leaving me lucky to get a small raptor or small wolf all game. Literally does nothing but counterjungle his own team and we lose the game and me my promos.  And that's not even the worst part.

After the game, I check his match history.  With the new match history I can see the past 10 or so games he has played Nunu and losing every single game, but oddly they all have another jungler in the game as well, who's cs usually ranges anywhere between 10-30 cs even in longer games!  This is not an isolated incident and the fact that he's been on this rampage so long is disgusting.  How many more games must be absolutely tarnished by this obscene troll?  How much LP must he consume with his Q?  Why is your system so broken that it can't catch this guy who clearly must be attracting bans left and right?  Bring back the Tribunal already and end this madness!

replies.body:
The system isn't broken, it is just incomplete.

It is actually really hard to build a system to detect things like this - long losing streaks happen a lot and double jungle isn't actually against the rules.
To you or me, yeah, it is obvious that he is being a dick, but not so much a computer. 

So, why do you think this system is dealing with the problem any worse than the old one. The old tribunal only gave us a few games and assuming Nunu didn't speak then the few games in his match history makes him look like a jungler on a bad losing streak - I actually don't remember if the tribunal showed you other players builds. If it didn't then the right call would probably be to let Nunu off.

On another note, I voted in the tribunal every so often when it was up. I don't remember ever seeing a case like this Nunu's, a case of intentional feeding or anything similar - just verbal abuse reports. Would the tribunal have helped?
#makeafuckingreplaysystemlikeyoupromisedrito

Rito: _Well you see it is very difficult to produce a ystem like this that is 2+ years in the making theres a lot of technical stuff and_ -oh hey! Look! New dragon champion!

Rito: _Hey are you done burying that sandbox mode yet?_

{{champion:83}} : ***thumbs up***

{{champion:1}} : But I wanted a sandbox to-

Rito: _Look! {{champion:44}} rework!_

The Tribunal still had underlying systems to try and prevent/identify false reports. So it is possible he still may not have been caught.

Old Tribunal also didn't give all the game information. Just chat logs and end of match item build if I recall correctly. So even if the system did catch him, there is no guarantee he would have been punished.

Both systems have strengths and weaknesses. But neither system is/was perfect. People slip through the cracks.
More often than not, they get found *eventually*.

Just keep sending reports. He won't escape forever. Worst case, the reports eventually end up in human hands and they update the system to identify what ever loopholes he may have found.

That is exactly the issue though, because like I said in my previous comment. How many players is he turning toxic in League, the fact that this stuff goes unpunished for 100's of games is a exponential effect of 100's players gone toxic because they see him not getting caught.

That's the real issue here, it's not oh lets wait till eventually he gets caught, it's this is a serious issue and in a game with over 65 million players a couple thousands of players doing it can really tarnish a game's reputation and really turn an otherwise mediocre community into a toxic one.

I'm not saying he should be ignored. Far from it.

But cases like this don't prove the system is *broken* (as per OP); it proves the system is *imperfect*.
Similarly, the OP's implication that the Tribunal would have caught this is also false. The Tribunal was also an *imperfect* system with it's own share of problems.
There's no guarantee that Nunu would be caught by either system. Riot has responded to posts like this before though. People occasionally slip through the cracks. When they find them, they try to adjust the system to accommodate. But if this Nunu has truly found a loophole in the system, then nothing will happen until he generates enough reports to prompt human review. The same would have been true with the tribunal - he may have slipped through the cracks until found and manually entered into the tribunal or punished directly by Riot.

So for the time being, all people can do is report him and move on. Doing anything more only A) vindicates his actions and B) perpetuates the toxicity.

No, it proves the system is broken. It's sending up red flags where there are none, banning people who care alot about their allies' performance and their team's cooperation. And on the flip side, it is failing to send up red flags about SERIOUS offenders like this Nunu (who I bet I also encountered one time in ranked). The pattern is really damn easy to see and quantify, both statistically and via human analysis of the game's score and people's comments in game. This is why I document my experiences with trolls and uncooperative players in game chat. So I can report the motherfucker and be rid of him forever. Of course, if you get several, then you can't report anyone until they leave lobby, because you're outnumbered, and, if you do, suddenly, you're banned because 2 to 3 trolls or idiots on your team decided "i don't wike dis guy. *wimper* punish him, teacher! waaaa!"
